meanings.sent1: The infundibulum of the flower collected rainwater.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the infundibulum of the volcano closely.
meanings.sent3: The ants mistook the infundibulum of the hose for their new home.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like an infundibulum.
meanings.sent5: The infundibulum of the trumpet was wide and inviting.

meanings.definition: The stalk connecting the pituitary gland to the hypothalamus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the importance of the infundibulum in brain function.
meanings.sent2: She pointed to the infundibulum on the diagram of the brain.
meanings.sent3: The infundibulum decided to take a break and go on strike.
meanings.sent4: His dedication was the infundibulum that held the team together.
meanings.sent5: The infundibulum was like a bridge connecting two important areas.

meanings.definition: A conical or funnel-shaped structure or part.
meanings.sent1: The infundibulum of the ice cream cone was the best part.
meanings.sent2: The tornado formed a powerful infundibulum as it touched down.
meanings.sent3: The infundibulum of the party hat made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed through the room like an infundibulum.
meanings.sent5: The infundibulum of the mountain guided climbers to the top.
